Great is who we are and what we do! At Great Clips, we know that stylists like you are most happy when they’re cutting hair, so at a Great Clips salon, that’s exactly what you get to do!  Want to be the best stylist in town? At Great Clips, that can happen. Want to be a salon manager or trainer or a member of an artistic design team? Yep, at Great Clips, you can make that happen, too. Your talent. Our support. Join a company with lots to offer. Whether you’re a new (or about to be new) stylist, or you’re an experienced stylist looking for your next career move, you’ll have the chance to: Make money right away with a guaranteed base wageReceive incentives and recognition for a job well doneCut hair for an immediate customer baseGet ongoing training and career advancementWork flexible schedulesLearn the latest trends and advanced skills Sounds good, right? Then we want to hear from you! At Great Clips, there’s no rule that says you can’t soar with scissors. Go do what you love doing with a great brand. Join our team of stylists today. You can use your mobile device to email jobs to yourself or others. You can apply to roles at KIPP from a laptop or desktop. Editorial Director APPLYKIPP KIPP Foundation Public Schools Multiple LocationsType: Leadership & Support StaffFull Time/Part Time: Full-TimeStart Date: ImmediateSubject:Grade:Organization: KIPP FoundationPreferred Locations:Flexible Location; San Francisco, CA; Chicago, IL; New York, NY; Washington, DCContact: Nikeya ElliottEmail: jobs@kipp.orgEMAIL JOBAbout KIPP KIPP is a non-profit network of over 200 college-preparatory, public charter schools educating 80,000 elementary, middle, and high school students. We believe that all students will learn and achieve at high levels if given the opportunity. Our mission is to help students develop the knowledge, skills, and character strengths they need to seize those opportunities. Why work at KIPP? We have bold goals. In 2014, we set a goal to double the number of students we serve by 2020. We need incredible people to help us reach that goal. Work in key support roles, teach eager minds, or even lead a KIPP school. Come grow with us. Our Team The Teaching and Learning team purpose is to develop, champion, and support a defined point of view around the instructional design practices that will enable our high school students to get to and through college. We also provide support and develop resources that improve the academic rigor sustainability of our high schools and regions and as a result identify and respond to network trends and needs to inform the Foundation’s instructional design offerings and trainings.The OpportunityThe KIPP Foundation seeks an energetic, entrepreneurial-minded, instructional Editorial Director to support high schools across our Network in achieving and sustaining excellence.  In particular, this person will be a key member of a cross-functional team working to roll out the second edition of pilot AP-aligned English and math curricula and launching pilot science and history curricula, with the goal of eventually providing the curricula to all KIPP high schools.Key Responsibilities The Editorial Director, High School Curriculum must be committed to the belief that outstanding school leaders and teachers can achieve excellent outcomes for all students. This person will:Manage, research, plan, design, and publish a program of pre-AP and AP courses to be piloted and eventually rolled out to KIPP high schools as part of a network-wide “AP for All” initiative that will prepare students for success on both the ACT and AP Exams. This person will:Serve as the project manager of an AP and ACT College and Career Readiness Standards (CCRS)-aligned academic programServe as an expert in the AP Program and evolving AP-aligned content landscape (English, Math, Science, and History and potentially other courses, including AP Computer Science and AP Capstone)Ensure that the pre-AP curricula are aligned to the ACT CCRSDesign and test prototypes and develop curriculum product specificationsIdentify, recruit, contract, and manage a team of contributing partners, authors, editors, and other consultants (including coordinating permissions and maintaining contracts)Oversee publishing schedule and all stages of the editorial development process to ensure successful, on-time (and on-budget) launch of all curriculum products; ensure that curricular materials are error free, user friendly, and cohesiveCollect and curate materials, exemplars, etc. from network and outside partnersStay up to date in trends with the AP Program to ensure product provides all learners with a rigorous college-ready curriculum meeting AP standardsSupport on-the-ground implementation and manage network feedback and product iteration process: In partnership with the High School Academic Strategies Director, develop and deliver curriculum-related training to high school teachersWork closely with a cross-team of colleagues to support implementation of curriculum products (starting in our pilot schools), including regular visits to pilot sites to work with teachers and leaders, and contribute to the curriculum adoption strategy for high schoolsDesign and execute process to regularly gather feedback on high school curriculum products from teachers, school leaders, and regional leaders as well as from high-performing charter management organizations (CMOs)Serve as curriculum liaison with pre-AP and AP course leadsServe as curriculum liaison with the K-8 curriculum team to ensure alignment across middle school and high school curriculaRegularly communicate with teachers/network to provide important curricular updates and guidanceIdentify high-priority network needs and translate these into curriculum product refinements and/or additional products to support high quality implementationQualifications Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree strongly preferred 6+ years of work experience in high school education and/or educational publishing6+ years of AP teaching (ideally in English, math, science, or history)Editorial experience with content development, preferably with AP materialsProject management experienceExcellent written and oral communication skillsExceptional interpersonal skills and comfort working closely with teachers, school leaders, and senior leadersLocation The preferred location of this role is our New York office, however exceptional candidates will be considered to work from our Chicago, San Francisco, or Washington, D.C. offices or remotely. This is a full-time, exempt position.The Editorial Director, High School Curriculum must be willing to travel (3-5 days per month) to work with a geographically distributed team and network of regions and schools.Compensation and Benefits We offer a competitive salary, as well as a comprehensive benefits package including: Healthcare (health, vision, and dental) provided at 100% for employees and 75% for dependentsVision is 100% for all dependents401k plan with up to a 4% salary matchGenerous time off: a. PTO starting accrual that equals 18 days a year  b. 15 holidays a year including a three-day Thanksgiving break (Wednesday – Friday) and the last week of the year (December 24 – January 1) And other great benefits! (i.e. gym reimbursement, Flexible spending account (FSA), cell phone reimbursement)

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:Penetrate accounts and radiate sales of a specific product or solution within an assigned territory or geographic region. Drive awareness. Meet and exceed assigned quota. Leverage both an individual and team selling approach on the desired solutionDevelop and implement a comprehensive sales plan by account or geography. Develop strong relationships with key decision makers and influencersAct as a trusted advisor to influence a customer’s technology platform decisions and develop preference and loyalty for Motorola Solutions. Builds trust through multiple communication methodsSchedule and lead customer meetings and demonstrations and close. Up-sell incremental solutions, as appropriate.Will lead and demonstrate specific solutions at Tradeshows, Events and RoadshowsDevelop innovative win-win solutions to address customer challenges. Uncovers viable solution options from the customer’s point of view.Strong understanding of key competitors within market space. Ability to predict what competitors will do in specific sales situations. Clearly articulates differentiators between our solutions and the competition. Leverages competitive successes.Create sales quotations for customersAchieve established daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly outbound call and sales performance targetsEstablish and build strong future opportunity pipeline and provide sales forecasts to managementEstablish trust and build strong business relationships with customers and assigned field teams.Partner with Account Managers to determine appropriate strategic sales approach. Be viewed as strategic partner and extended team memberAttend quarterly business reviews (QBR), participate on weekly territory calls and make in-field visits, as appropriate. Present results and forecast, as requiredTravel, as required. Approximately 25%QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelors degree is required Prefer emphasis in Business or related field1+ years of sales experience. Seeking field sales or inside sales experienceProven sales achievement in a remote selling environment a PLUSExperience developing collaborative relationshipsClosing skills: Winning sales campaigns after they have progressed past Needs Development; closing late stage deals; developing reasons for prospects to act; overcoming late stage deal obstacles; winning confidence and support of late stage new entrants to the sales campaignExperience delivering presentationsProficient computer skills with emphasis on Windows or Google based applicationsDESIRED BEHAVIORS:Customer focused; detail orientedAbility to maintain a positive attitude in a high stress/fast paced work environmentConfident individual who is willing to assume responsibilitySelf-motivated with a high degree of drive and determinationStrong individual contributor and team playerAdaptive and flexible (changing technologies, processes, environments)Job ID 4218BR Country United States Basic RequirementsBachelors Degree1+ years of sales experienceRelocation Provided None Position Type Experienced Job Category Sales Department Description The Solutions Advisor is responsible for being the subject matter expert, champion and advocate for a specific solution or product within our overall portfolio. Their top priority is to radiate sales of a specific solution within our overall product portfolio. Develops new prospects and interacts with existing customers to increase sales and adoption of new technologies and solutions. Lead customer demonstrations that highlight and differentiate our solutions and value proposition. Strategically partners with Field Account Managers and serves as an overlay to help supplement their effort to drive next generation solutions and services. The Solutions Advisor is held accountable and incented for individual achievement of specific business targets and results. The Solutions Advisor is typically assigned to a geographic territory and is responsible for establishing a strong rapport and relationship with internal field teams and both existing and potential customers. This role is 100% remote-based selling with in-field travel required Company Overview On any given day, every moment matters to someone, somewhere. And every moment, Motorola Solutions’ innovations, products and services play essential roles in people’s lives. We help firefighters see around buildings and police officers see around street corners. We keep utility workers connected and visible to each other with real-time voice and data communication across the smart grid. And we provide the situational awareness first responders need when a moment brings catastrophe. We help people be their best in their moments that matter. State/Region/Province Illinois EEO Statement Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to no discrimination because of race, color, creed, marital status, age, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, disability, protected veteran, or any other legally protected characteristic.

Seeking field sales or inside sales experienceProven sales achievement in a remote selling environment a PLUSExperience developing collaborative relationshipsClosing skills: Winning sales campaigns after they have progressed past Needs Development; closing late stage deals; developing reasons for prospects to act; overcoming late stage deal obstacles; winning confidence and support of late stage new entrants to the sales campaignExperience delivering presentationsProficient computer skills with emphasis on Windows or Google based applicationsDESIRED BEHAVIORS:Customer focused; detail orientedAbility to maintain a positive attitude in a high stress/fast paced work environmentConfident individual who is willing to assume responsibilitySelf-motivated with a high degree of drive and determinationStrong individual contributor and team playerAdaptive and flexible (changing technologies, processes, environments)Job ID 4218BR Country United States Basic RequirementsBachelors Degree1+ years of sales experienceRelocation Provided None Position Type Experienced Job Category Sales Department Description The Solutions Advisor is responsible for being the subject matter expert, champion and advocate for a specific solution or product within our overall portfolio. Their top priority is to radiate sales of a specific solution within our overall product portfolio. Develops new prospects and interacts with existing customers to increase sales and adoption of new technologies and solutions. Lead customer demonstrations that highlight and differentiate our solutions and value proposition. Strategically partners with Field Account Managers and serves as an overlay to help supplement their effort to drive next generation solutions and services. The Solutions Advisor is held accountable and incented for individual achievement of specific business targets and results. The Solutions Advisor is typically assigned to a geographic territory and is responsible for establishing a strong rapport and relationship with internal field teams and both existing and potential customers. This role is 100% remote-based selling with in-field travel required Company Overview On any given day, every moment matters to someone, somewhere. And every moment, Motorola Solutions’ innovations, products and services play essential roles in people’s lives. We help firefighters see around buildings and police officers see around street corners. We keep utility workers connected and visible to each other with real-time voice and data communication across the smart grid. And we provide the situational awareness first responders need when a moment brings catastrophe. We help people be their best in their moments that matter. Founded in 1999, ZirMed is the nations only company delivering proven end-to-end cloud-based business and clinical performance management solutions to meet the challenges of managing population health and optimizing fee-for-service and fee-for-value reimbursements. ZirMed combines innovative software development with the industrys most advanced transactional network and predictive analytics platform to improve the business and process of healthcare, give organizations a clearer view of their financial and operational performance, and streamline critical connections between providers, patients, and payers.We're always improving, always testing, always changing, and there's never a dull moment. In the rapidly changing world of healthcare technology, we stay ahead of the curve.What is the purpose of this position?Right now, we are looking for an experienced Contract Analyst who has previously supported healthcare software applications or served in a healthcare contract management role. The Contract Analyst will serve as a business contact for our clients regarding contract management and is responsible for maintaining clients managed care and government contracts. A successful candidate for this Contract Analyst role will establish himself/herself as a trusted advisor and liaison to the client. This positions main responsibility will be to serve as the primary contact for our customers regarding contracts, including implementing new contracts, updating existing contracts, validating contract terms, and addressing any client issues or concerns. An ideal candidate for this position can approach problem-solving challenges independently, a strong attention to detail, enjoys working in a fast-paced, collaborative and team-based environment. Do you fit our team? Responsible for implementing contract terms in ZirMed's Contract Management solutionPerform validation of contract terms by reviewing account examples and confirming correct contract term and expected reimbursement generatedManage the contract workflow to ensure timely and accurate implementation of contractsResponsible for collaborating with client during contract interpretation and validation stagesBachelor degree1 year of contract analyst experience in healthcare software or healthcare consulting environmentAbility to interpret contract language from managed care contractsAbility to interpret regulatory guidelines from CMS, Tricare, and Medicaid websitesAbility to understand the vocabulary used in a hospitals revenue cycle operations, including healthcare coding such as DRGs, CPT/HCPC, Revenue Codes, APG and APCAn in-depth subject matter expertise and dedication to remaining current with industry and/or relevant legislative changes and advancesMust be a quick learner with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environmentOutstanding communication and interpersonal skillsMust possess strong analytical and problem-solving skillsProficient in Microsoft Office applicationsDetail-orientedPrior experience working in a contract management role preferredMust be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer.

About you: You have the rare combination of technical savviness and business acumen and youre looking for a career where you can utilize both. As a Sales Enginer at Twilio, you will hone each of these skills by advising a diverse set of customers on what is possible using Twilios API.  Sales Engineers at Twilio are involved in all stages of the customers software development lifecycle and are comfortable using presentations, email, phone and social media to connect with customers. We are looking for someone who can create sales presentations, product demonstrations, and educate customers (everyone from developers to product managers to C-level executives) on the best ways to utilize cloud communications technology. Twilios Sales Engineers are empowered to come up with creative solutions on the spot so we are looking for someone willing to challenge the status quo and throw out the manual on occasion. Responsibilities:Educate customers on what is possible with Twilio.Articulate and provide value to customers by advising them on the integration points of the Twilio API into their platform.Ability to compare and contrast various providers in the industry, along with how Twilio would stack up and be able to clearly articulate (with experience) the advantages of building versus buying.Understand customer requirements and communicate the business value of solving technology problems using cloud communications technology.Guide the design and deployment of enterprise communications systems that impact multiple functional areas of a customers organization.Create technical content to show customers how to implement specific use cases or best practices for new technologies.Prepare demos and proof of concepts to demonstrate various use cases for Twilios APIs.Distill and communicate customer needs and product feedback to Product Management, Engineering, Marketing and Sales.Document the architectural solutions that customers have designed and deployed for internal use.Requirements:Four or more years in a customer-facing technical role.A strong understanding of the software development lifecycle.Experience in one or more of the following areas: web development, mobile development, IP-based telephony and real-time communications.A firm understanding of enterprise integration best practices, service oriented architecture and models for sharing IT services across the enterprise.A world class communicator. Confident dispensing knowledge to a highly skilled and experienced audience including C-level executives.Typically 10-25% travel, depending on role.Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, MIS or a comparable field is preferred.Bonus Points:Good knowledge base about how to structure and architect web applicationsHow to Apply: Include a link to an application (or two!) that youve built using Twilio. About us: Twilio's mission is to fuel the future of communications. Developers and businesses use Twilio to make communications relevant and contextual by embedding messaging, voice, and video capabilities directly into their software applications. Founded in 2008, Twilio has over 800 employees, with headquarters in San Francisco and other offices in Bogotá, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Madrid, Malmö, Mountain View, Munich, New York City, Singapore and Tallinn. Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. #LI-POST

This role is for just any UX designer.  This role is for a talented, thoughtful and ambitious product design creative - with something to prove. After 20 years of becoming the Natural and Specialty products industrys leading data provider, SPINS is seeking a product design visionary who is excited about transforming the way brands, retailers, distributors and consumers access and utilize information to improve their lives.  With a bleeding-edge portfolio of big data technologies, business intelligence and visualization tools and ventures division focused on incubating new emerging 3rd party technologies, SPINS is investing in the next level of design leadership to accelerate the fluency between our rapidly-expanding products, including breaking new barriers on how information gets delivered, how it is accessed via desktop, tablet and mobile devices, and how we can establish an expectation with our clients of over-delivering on their product experience expectations. What will the job entail:Relentless pursuit of improvement. We strive for perfection, but in an agile environment, we value a design leaders passion for constantly seeking new ways to enhance the experience, regardless of what the original objectives are.Developing and maintaining a product design standards that bring our fast-growing portfolio of business intelligence, data visualization and consumer engagement software products together under a universal SPINS-branded design vision.Working alongside marketing, product management, engineering, and sales to inform the approach to over-deliver on client expectations of our products.Utilizing intelligent and creative design practices to deliver high-impact product with large quantities of data, through a fresh, simple and intuitive experience for users.Discovery & Product Requirement RoundtablesCollaborating with the product management team around requirements and asking how and why on behalf of the user so the design was informed by their needsConcepting, Wireframing & Aligning ExpectationsExperimenting with new ways to tell stories through the wealth of data and insights SPINS is always seeking to deliver more efficiently to customers.Wireframing including thoughtful approaches to navigation, layout, responsive design consideration, user typesEstablishing A&B testing scenarios when applicable to generate the greatest insight in how to further optimize experiences around a users most organic behaviorsSharing and soliciting feedback from various product stakeholders to ensure the concepting is building alignment of expectations prior to the design and development processPresentation, Polish & Go-To-MarketCreation of high-fidelity design concepts that adhere to product style standards, but also continue to break new barriers on introducing new experiences to interact with the data to customers whenever applicable.Presentation of design to product and client-facing teams to encourage feedback to further refine the approach and account for final opportunities for improvements prior to developmentCollaborating with product QA team throughout the product development process to ensure designs are properly translating through the various phases of the development process all the way through new product launchesCollaborating with the marketing team on bring out the best design components of new products or features that can be incorporated into client communicationsWhile your talent and experience matters most, we have to mention these qualifications matter to us:Bachelors degree in Design, HCI, a related subject or equivalent work experienceConversant in front-end technologies: CSS & HTMLExperience in practicing a user-centered design approach to software productsOutstanding project management, organization, communication and team building skillsStrong understanding of responsive design principles and best practicesStrong proficiency with data-driven product design & softwareAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic and collaborative environmentExperience in data visualization designExperience bringing a new product to marketWere even more impressed if you:Graduate degree in Design, HCI, a related subject, or equivalent work experienceExperience designing and conducting user studies and usability testingWork experience with another data visualization software or web-based product companyExperience with user interviewing and usability testingExcited by the challenge to delight users with new features they didnt expectAre obsessed with delivering the most amount of value to an end user, requiring the least amount of their effort

JOB SUMMARY Account Executive is responsible for helping attract new customers for our product or services. The primary objective of this position is to achieve or exceed the sales goals or target set for each quarter. Sales collaborates with other departments to sell the product and services leaving our customers extremely satisfied. DUTIES & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSExecutes on sales strategy, goals, objectives, and implementation plans to close sufficient new business to achieve sales quotas.Establishes new accounts by planning and organizing daily work schedule to call on existing or potential sales outlets and other trade factors.Attends business networking groups representing the company in a positive manner and building relationships with key players.Focuses sales efforts by studying existing and potential businesses.Executes on sales activities to establish and enhance market presence and lead flow.Develops and maintains a consistent pipeline and qualify new business leads.Communicates with sales leads and customer by phone or email as soon as possible following the initial contact.Evaluates and responds to formal Requests for Proposal or Requests for Information.Work closely with Sales Engineers to answer technical questions and proactively present the value added our products.Execute marketing initiatives in support of sales activities as needed/requested.Achieves and maintains rapport with customers and works to give them the best possible service through the sales cycle.Works closely with other departments to ensure completion of the sale and/or customization needs.Keeps management informed by submitting activity and results reports, such as daily call reports, weekly work plans, and monthly and annual territory analyses.Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending training, reviewing professional publications.Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.Will meet the minimum expected timeline and attempts for contacting and following up on our customer leads.Demonstrates and maintains a positive attitude internally and externallyCOMPETENCIESAbility to Multi Task: Proven ability to manage multiple issues and/or projects successfully bringing them all to resolution in a timely manner.Problem Solving: Anticipates problems, recognizes and accurately evaluates the signs of a problems and analyzes current procedures for possible improvements.Customer Service: Listens and responds effectively to customer questions; resolves customer problems to the customers satisfaction. Respects all internal and external customers and uses a team approach when dealing with customers in order to exceeding customer expectations.Detail Orientation: Thoroughness in accomplishing a task through concern for all the areas involved, no matter how small. Monitors and checks work or information and plans and organizes time and resources efficiently.QUALIFICATIONSAssociates or Bachelor's Degree in Business or related field or 4+ years equivalent experience.5-10 years of previous sales experience with proven track record in commission roleConfident and assertive approach with the ability to deal with difficult situations.Ability to network and build trust both internally and externally.Ability to navigate and bring clarity to complex situations. SentryOne is an Equal Opportunity Employer

WE ARE OUTCOME ACTIVATORS We are a health-tech company on a mission to activate the best health outcome possible for every person in the world. We solve hard problems - healthcare is a fragmented industry and were transforming it by creating an ecosystem through our technology platform that brings together all the players to collectively improve patient outcomes. Our team is entrepreneurial and thrives in ambiguity with a strong commitment to scrappy excellence to drive patient impact. We empower every Outcome Activator to own their decisions and outcomes in service to the mission, while also contributing to a collaborative environment thats communally competitive.  With hubs in Chicago and NYC, we've been growing 100% YoY and will impact half a billion patient visits in 2017, as physicians, life science companies and patients adopt our technology platform to make better health decisions during the most critical moments at the point-of-care. With 200,000 physicians already utilizing our portfolio of 5 current products at their practices, we still bring a fresh outlook to our pursuits with humble invincibility, whether youre new to the family or have been hustling with us since the beginning.  Join our family to activate good in the world. WHO ARE YOU You are a dynamic and highly-organized collaborator with experience in keeping legal operations efficient and organized in a fast-paced environment. You will work closely with the Head of Legal, providing executive administrative support, including scheduling and calendar management, travel arrangements, expense report submission and communication management. You will also be responsible for key legal operational tasks, including, drafting and/or proofreading correspondence, filing, obtaining signatures, maintaining meeting minute books, and comparing contracts against approved forms. You will be involved in managing a variety of legal projects and must be willing to roll up your sleeves to tackle any tasks at hand. Were looking for someone with a well-honed client service ethic with outstanding communications skills as you work with internal and external stakeholders.  You have a passion for bringing structure where it does not exist, providing a smooth experience while owning a variety of tasks, and you thrive in a culture of innovation. Experience supporting law firm partners and/or corporate legal departments a plus, but you must also be comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment where the playbook is waiting for you to write it. Qualifications:The ability to meet the needs of a high-growth, fast-paced company;Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent work experience);Strong oral communication and writing skills (ex: correspondence assembling decks, memo writing, crafting templates, etc.);Strong attention to detail including proofreading skills;At least 2 years experience providing administrative support to legal executive and/or legal department;Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPointThe ability to see a task to completion with minimal guidance.Preferred skills:Experience with Google Calendar, Gmail, Google Docs, Google Drive and DocuSign;Experience with preparing affidavits, drafting forms, and maintaining sensitive legal documents;Experience preparing, processing and maintaining statutory and regulatory filings and records;Experience managing legal invoice workflow;Experience reviewing and redlining contracts against established tempaltes;Notary public or ability to obtain notary public status;At least 3 years of relevant experience working either at a law firm, a technology company, a healthcare-related company or an advertising company.

PMO Analyst Location  IL - Chicago Office Functional Area  Technology Employment Status  RegularApply NowAbout Press Ganey: Press Ganey is a leading provider of patient experience measurement, performance analytics and strategic advisory solutions for health care organizations across the continuum of care. Celebrating 30 years of experience, Press Ganey is recognized as a pioneer and thought leader in patient experience measurement and performance improvement solutions. Our mission is to help health care organizations reduce patient suffering and improve clinical quality, safety and the patient experience. Position Description/Overview: The PMO Analyst is primarily responsible for all financial and resource management and reporting functions. Coordinates project-related activities and resources of the IT organization and business to ensure goals and objectives of projects are accomplished within both prearranged time frames and funding parameters. Facilitates the resource and financial management processes by tracking and analyzing resources and committed and actual effort and costs and by administering the PPM and Agile tools. Monitors and updates project-related information, including the creation of new projects, administration of time entry, and entry of project-related budgets and invoice tracking. Duties & Responsibilities:Serve as primary liaison to Accounting and Financial Planning and Analysis teams with ad hoc analysis, data sourcing, research and financial and project reporting.Utilize Excel and other Business Intelligence tools to analyze planned and actuals for both budget and resource metrics and to provide visibility of resource utilization and availability to IT management.Support Project Management team’s adherence to project management best practices and methodologies such as Project Management Institute or similar standards and update project management process documentation as processes evolve.Oversee project close activities by supporting Project Management staff with a final budget to actuals, final project plans and project site archiving, completed project reviews, and surveys.Oversee the compilation of the monthly IT Operations report to ensure quality, accuracy, and timeliness of delivery.Oversee the compilation of the monthly Governance report to ensure consistency of the materials presented and facilitate the meeting, adhering to the timeline.Coordinate, facilitate and lead various small to mid-size projects.Partner with Project Managers and the PMO to design, develop, and publish meaningful project and program reports and dashboards that can be used to communicate status metrics to product owners and upper management.Provide training and support for the onboarding of new hires on PPM and Agile tools along with overall PMO processes.Exhibit flexibility and willingness to take on new responsibilities and assignments as they are identified.Qualifications:Ability to work with functional groups and different levels of employees to effectively and professionally achieve results.Strong track record of collaboration and building and maintaining solid relationships with internal and external customers.Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present ideas and suggestions clearly and effectively.Strong attention to detail and accuracy and strong analytical, problem-solving and conceptual skills to support project reporting requirements.Strong organizational skills; ability to accomplish multiple tasks within agreed upon timeframes through autonomous, effective prioritization of duties and functions in a fast paced environment.Strong follow-up skills; ability to organize applicable department timelines and proactively follow up with internal and external customer needs.Self-motivated; able to work independently to complete tasks and respond to department requests and to collaborate with others to utilize their resources and knowledge to identify quality solutions.Strong computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (i.e., Excel, PowerPoint, Visio) required along with hands-on administration of PPM and Agile tools.Ability to create reports and dashboards within Tableau is a plus.Minimum Education:Bachelor’s degree in Business or Management, Computer Science, Finance, Accounting or other related disciplines, or equivalent work experience, required.A minimum of five (5) years of working experience, or equivalent experience required.A minimum of two years of experience in a project-oriented environment preferred.Conceptual knowledge of information technology and project management methodologies preferred.Experience with financial and accounting processes and procedures preferred. All positions at Press Ganey require an applicant who has accepted an offer to undergo a background check. The specific checks are based on the nature of the position. Background checks may include some or all of the following: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. By applying for a position with Press Ganey, you understand that you will be required to undergo a background check should you be made an offer. You also understand that the offer is contingent upon successful completion of the background check and results consistent with Press Ganey's employment policies. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required for the position.  For more information about Press Ganey, visit our web site at pressganey.com .  Press Ganey Associates, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and well committed to a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.  Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Notice – Press Ganey will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information.  #LI-JZ1

Job Title Cloud Sales Executive Phoenix Advert Sage energizes the success of businesses and their communities around the world through the use of smart technology and the imagination of our People. Sage has reimagined business and brings energy, experience and technology to inspire our customers to fulfil their dreams. We work with a thriving community to entrepreneurs, business owners, tradespeople, accountants, partners and developers who drive the global economy. Sage is a FTSE 100 company with 14,000 employees in 24 countries.  EOE AA/M/F/Vet/Disability  Sage Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We comply with the laws set forth in the EEO is the law poster:  http://bit.ly/2l9bz7h Job Description Responsible for selling the full line of Sage Payroll Services’ (SPR) Payroll and HR services to tier 1 and tier 2 mid-market accounts. The SPR Sales Manager drives sales revenue by building a relationship with key players in their prospects, bank partners, CPA firms and banks; becoming a trusted advisor on SPR products/solutions to meet the needs of their accounts; and maintaining an on-going account strategy for selling Sage products. The SPR Sales Manager stays in total engagement with the account during the sales cycle while bringing in additional necessary resources from the Sales Group or strategic Business Partner. The position requires significant time in face-to-face customer and prospect calls.Key Responsibilities Essential Responsibilities:With general direction, creates and executes Territory Plan to drive revenue by identifying and cultivating new prospects in assigned territoryDrive Payroll and HR Services Sales to achieve or exceed QuotaContributes to the entire sales cycle of transaction from discovery to first live payrollSupport and drive pipeline and velocityProvide accurate forecast to his/her ManagementAssist with completion and submission of accurate new business paperwork including tax forms and Power of Attorneys.Update CRM on a daily basisEnsures accuracy of weekly activity reports and commission coversheetsAssist Sr Director of Sales by mentoring new account manager’s by conducting ride-alongs, assisting in territory management and general questions.Attend sales meetings held twice weekly Qualifications and Requirements: (this section should include required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities as well as Credentials and Experience) Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience preferred2+ years of complex sales experienceKnowledge of the software industryProficient with Microsoft Office SuiteFamiliarity with CRM software and reporting toolsDetailed knowledge of Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and OutlookCompetencies Action Oriented Enjoys working hard; is action oriented and full of energy for the things he/she sees as challenging; not fearful of acting with a minimum of planning; seizes more opportunities than others.  Approachability Is easy to approach and talk to; spends the extra effort to put others at ease; can be warm, pleasant, and gracious; is sensitive to and patient with the interpersonal anxieties of others; builds rapport well; is a good listener; is an early knower, getting informal and incomplete information in time to do something about it.  Customer Focus Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.  Drive for Results Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for results.  Functional/Technical Skills Has the functional and technical knowledge and skills to do the job at a high level of accomplishment.  Listening Practices attentive and active listening; has the patience to hear people out; can accurately restate the opinions of others even when he/she disagrees.  Perseverance Pursues everything with energy, drive, and a need to finish; seldom gives up before finishing, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks.  Presentation Skills Is effective in a variety of formal presentation settings: one-on-one, small and large groups, with peers, direct reports, and bosses; is effective both inside and outside the organization, on both cool data and hot and controversial topics; commands attention and can manage group process during the presentation; can change tactics midstream when something isn't working.  Time Management Uses his/her time effectively and efficiently; values time; concentrates his/her efforts on the more important priorities; gets more done in less time than others; can attend to a broader range of activities.  Written Communications Is able to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles; can get messages across that have the desired effect.  © Copyright 1992-2009 Lominger International: A Korn/Ferry Company All Rights Reserved. Function Sales Country United States Office Location Remote Location Region Arizona

Coordinates the care and services of selected member populations across the continuum of illness. Promotes effective utilization and monitors health care resources. Assumes a leadership role within the interdisciplinary team to achieve optimal clinical and resource outcomes. Works with the Supervisor / Manager of Case Management to assess, plan, implement, coordinate, monitor and evaluate services and outcomes to maximize the health of the Member. Essential Functions:In conjunction with the PCP and member, completes a comprehensive assessment and develops a care plan utilizing clinical expertise to evaluate the member's need for alternative services. Assess short-term and long-term needs and establishes case management objectives.Manages 60 to 80 active cases based on case intensity and acuity. Specialty Case Manager case loads may vary.Interacts continuously with member, family, physician(s) and other providers utilizing clinical knowledge and expertise to determine medical history and current status. Assess the options for care including use of benefits and community resources to update the care plan.Acts as liaison and member advocate between the member/family, physician and facilities/agencies.Maintains accurate records of case management activities in the EMMA System using clinical guidelines.Coordinates community resources with emphasis on medical, behavioral and social services. Applies case management standards and maintains HIPAA standards and confidentiality of protected health information. Reports critical incidents and information regarding quality of care issues.Ensures compliance with all state and federal regulations and guidelines in day-to-day activities.Schedules or facilitates scheduling appointments and follow-up servicesRequests consultation and diagnostic reports from network specialists.Contacts members to remind them about upcoming appointments and/or missed appointments.Participates in monthly chart audits.Performs special projects as assigned.Additional Responsibilities:Case load may differ by state and/or location based on contract requirements, membership, plan and/or operational best practice.Some states and/or locations may require nurses to occasionally travel to facility or inpatient bedside to conduct assessments or face to face visits.Specific state specialty programs may require initial and annual training hours related to the area of specialty.LI-WellcareCandidate Education:Required a High School or GEDPreferred a Bachelor's Degree in nursing or related fieldRequired Illinois's HIV/AIDS specialty program requires either a Bachelor's degree or 4 years Case management experience and experience in addictive & dysfunctional family systems, racial & ethnic minorities, homosexuals, persons with AIDS and substance abusers.Required Illinois's Children with High Needs program requires a bachelor's degree in nursing, social sciences, social work or related field.Candidate Experience:Required 2 years of experience in a clinical acute care position(s), preferably in home health, physicians office or public healthRequired 1 year of experience in current case management experienceCandidate Skills:Intermediate ability to drive multiple projects a plusIntermediate ability to multi-taskIntermediate ability to work in a fast paced environment with changing prioritiesIntermediate ability to work independently, handle multiple assignments and prioritize workloadIntermediate demonstrated time management and priority setting skillsIntermediate demonstrated interpersonal/verbal communication skillsIntermediate ability to create, review and interpret treatment plans Ability to create, review and interpret treatment plansIntermediate demonstrated negotiation skillsIntermediate ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from families, members, and providersAbility to effectively present information and respond to questions from peers and managementIntermediate ability to implement process improvementsLicenses and Certifications: A license in one of the following is required: Required Licensed Registered Nurse (RN)Preferred Certified Case Manager (CCM)Required must have or become IM-CANS certified within 30 days of hire/start and be re-certified annuallyTechnical Skills:Required beginner Microsoft ExcelIntermediate knowledge and skills of MS Office including Word and Outlook ExpressRequired Beginner Healthcare Management Systems (Generic)Languages:Preferred Integra LifeSciences, a world leader in medical technology, is dedicated to limiting uncertainty for surgeons, so they can concentrate on providing the best patient care. Integra offers innovative solutions in orthopedic extremity surgery, neurosurgery, reconstructive and general surgery, and regenerative wound care.  Integra's orthopedic products include devices and implants for foot and ankle, hand and wrist, shoulder and elbow, tendon and peripheral nerve protection and repair. Integra is a leader in neurosurgery, offering a broad portfolio of implants, devices, instruments and systems used in neurosurgery, neuromonitoring, neurotrauma, and related critical care. Integra’s Tissue Technologies is an in-patient and outpatient Regenerative product portfolio, which includes products for wound care, burns, abdominal reconstruction, and plastic & reconstructive surgery. In the United States, Integra is a leading provider of surgical instruments to hospitals, surgery centers and alternate care sites, including physician and dental offices.  Founded in 1989 Integra is headquartered in Plainsboro, New Jersey and has over 3,300 employees worldwide. Integra's common stock is listed on The NASDAQ Stock Market under the symbol "IART."  The Clinical Resource Specialist supports the vision of a global, market leading wound care organization: Promotes the educational growth and development of the sales force with materials and within approved parameters.Develops collegial/professional relationships with HCPs to improve patient and clinical outcomes.Develops an evidence-based approach to promotional activities. Promotes an environment to assist with identification of potential KOLs and refers to Medical Affairs potential investigators for development of clinical evidence Ensures compliance with Integra policies and proceduresDUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESDevelops and delivers educational programs to appropriate audiences and groups and specifically those of the larger target audiences including corporate account and at the national and international levels. (Approved Program content and materials)Coordinates clinical resource and education activities with sales force, sales management and Corporate Accounts to assist in the achievement of sales goals. This will include a significant amount of travel (approximately 40% – 50%) assisting sales managers with presentations to customers.Explores with clients, territory managers, and regional managers, issues related to customer clinical and practice needs and assists in the implementation of programs/presentations to meet those needs. Recognizes and refers off-label questions to Medical Affairs.Seeks opportunities to represent the company in national forums - speaking opportunities, committee or board membership, and/or writing for publication.Assists in the development of curricula and all related materials for educational programs. This includes both medical educational materials and programs for customers, as well as educational materials and programs for sales reps.Maintains state-of-the-art knowledge of current clinical literature, trends in healthcare and related topics through survey and research utilizing traditional and innovative resources.Develops and maintains collegial relationships with healthcare professionals, industry leaders, and business partners.Participates in educational events and business meetings with corporate partners to act as the key clinical contact when needed for the partner from the bedside level to the C-suite.Participates in professional organizations on local, regional and national levels. Participates in trade shows as requested.Acts as a Company clinical resource representative, answering clinical questions when appropriate (from end users, clinicians, or Company’s internal regulatory/quality department)DESIRED MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required for his position. Educational preparation includes a Bachelor’s degree in nursing, physical therapy or a related specialty; WOCN or CWS strongly preferred, completion required within first year of hirePrevious experience in a similar role of field-based sales and marketing support at another wound care company with demonstrated successKnowledge of the wound care industry, prior experience with tissue products strongly preferredDemonstrates evidence of expertise and leadership in the practice of wound care to complement the vision of the company.Experience in developing and implementing educational programs for HCPs, including physicians and nurses.Confident, experienced public speaker including large national or international events.Prior experience in managing field based direct reports.This position requires 50-75% travel.Computer Literate: MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point), Outlook)

Marcel Digital is an award winning digital marketing and web development agency established in 2003 and located in the River North neighborhood of downtown Chicago. We strive to establish ourselves as trusted business partners to our clients and bring transparency to their digital marketing solutions. We pride ourselves on being a family of A players and are focused on helping our clients achieve their most important business goals. We are currently looking for a Project Manager to join our growing team of experts. What does a Digital Project Manager Do? Marcel is seeking a detail-oriented, organized, versatile, highly motivated and creative individual that will provide project management expertise on web development projects, as well as ongoing digital marketing (SEO, CRO, Paid Search, Analytics) campaigns. The Digital Project Manager will have:Organizational and project management skills to manage the deliverables, scope, time and cost of website development projects and digital marketing campaignsEffective communication to work directly with clients as well as internal teams, including design, development, SEO, Paid Search, and CRO departmentsA positive attitude towards clients and colleagues while also focusing on business realities and hitting deadlines.An excitement to work with an entrepreneurial digital agencyResponsibilities include but are not limited to:Drive all aspects of project management including: scope, timelines, budget, available resources, communication, requirements, and risks.Lead client teams through successful website launches, adhering to (and improving) our agile web development process.Lead client teams through ongoing execution of digital marketing campaigns, adhering to (and improving) processes.Ensure on time, on budget, delivery of services that achieve results and client happiness.Anticipate client questions and provide thought out answers, using our SMEs as needed.Translate clients business objectives into executable project plans for internal teams.Create visibility and transparency (one of our core values) into the progress of the project for client stakeholders.Use lessons learned from previous projects to instill a culture of continuous improvement.Ability to understand technically complex concepts and articulate to clients clearly.Work tightly with Development, Paid, Design, Analytics, and Conversion teams to ensure a working familiarity with our services.Provide organization, presentation skills and pre-sale support to Sales and Marketing teams for prospective clients.Provide reporting to Account Managers and clients on progress and results, escalating when needed.Key Qualifications:3+ years of Project Management experienceRequired experience running website development projects or running digital marketing campaignsPreferred experience working at an agencyBachelors degree requiredExemplary communication skills and clarity of thoughtHigh competency in project planning and tracking toolsPMP certification a plusSCRUM certifications a plusExperience in agile web project management a plusExperience with digital marketing a plusKnowledge of Nicolas Cage a plusExperience with Trello and Slack a plusWhat does Marcel Digital Offer In Return? Theres the normal stuff, such as competitive salary, great benefits and a 401k. Theres also the casual, fun work environment, ample PTO, work from home options, free annual Divvy membership, and monthly work outings. But more than that, you get an environment of autonomy, support, transparency, and growth. You get a team that works together to do whats best for their clients above anything else. Editorial Director APPLYKIPP KIPP Foundation Public Schools Multiple LocationsType: Leadership & Support StaffFull Time/Part Time: Full-TimeStart Date: ImmediateSubject:Grade:Organization: KIPP FoundationPreferred Locations:Flexible Location; San Francisco, CA; Chicago, IL; New York, NY; Washington, DCContact: Nikeya ElliottEmail: jobs@kipp.orgEMAIL JOBAbout KIPP KIPP is a non-profit network of over 200 college-preparatory, public charter schools educating 80,000 elementary, middle, and high school students. We believe that all students will learn and achieve at high levels if given the opportunity. Our mission is to help students develop the knowledge, skills, and character strengths they need to seize those opportunities. Why work at KIPP? We have bold goals. In 2014, we set a goal to double the number of students we serve by 2020. We need incredible people to help us reach that goal. Work in key support roles, teach eager minds, or even lead a KIPP school. Come grow with us. Our Team The Teaching and Learning team purpose is to develop, champion, and support a defined point of view around the instructional design practices that will enable our high school students to get to and through college. We also provide support and develop resources that improve the academic rigor sustainability of our high schools and regions and as a result identify and respond to network trends and needs to inform the Foundation’s instructional design offerings and trainings.The OpportunityThe KIPP Foundation seeks an energetic, entrepreneurial-minded, instructional Editorial Director to support high schools across our Network in achieving and sustaining excellence.  In particular, this person will be a key member of a cross-functional team working to roll out the second edition of pilot AP-aligned English and math curricula and launching pilot science and history curricula, with the goal of eventually providing the curricula to all KIPP high schools.Key Responsibilities The Editorial Director, High School Curriculum must be committed to the belief that outstanding school leaders and teachers can achieve excellent outcomes for all students. This person will:Manage, research, plan, design, and publish a program of pre-AP and AP courses to be piloted and eventually rolled out to KIPP high schools as part of a network-wide “AP for All” initiative that will prepare students for success on both the ACT and AP Exams. This person will:Serve as the project manager of an AP and ACT College and Career Readiness Standards (CCRS)-aligned academic programServe as an expert in the AP Program and evolving AP-aligned content landscape (English, Math, Science, and History and potentially other courses, including AP Computer Science and AP Capstone)Ensure that the pre-AP curricula are aligned to the ACT CCRSDesign and test prototypes and develop curriculum product specificationsIdentify, recruit, contract, and manage a team of contributing partners, authors, editors, and other consultants (including coordinating permissions and maintaining contracts)Oversee publishing schedule and all stages of the editorial development process to ensure successful, on-time (and on-budget) launch of all curriculum products; ensure that curricular materials are error free, user friendly, and cohesiveCollect and curate materials, exemplars, etc. from network and outside partnersStay up to date in trends with the AP Program to ensure product provides all learners with a rigorous college-ready curriculum meeting AP standardsSupport on-the-ground implementation and manage network feedback and product iteration process: In partnership with the High School Academic Strategies Director, develop and deliver curriculum-related training to high school teachersWork closely with a cross-team of colleagues to support implementation of curriculum products (starting in our pilot schools), including regular visits to pilot sites to work with teachers and leaders, and contribute to the curriculum adoption strategy for high schoolsDesign and execute process to regularly gather feedback on high school curriculum products from teachers, school leaders, and regional leaders as well as from high-performing charter management organizations (CMOs)Serve as curriculum liaison with pre-AP and AP course leadsServe as curriculum liaison with the K-8 curriculum team to ensure alignment across middle school and high school curriculaRegularly communicate with teachers/network to provide important curricular updates and guidanceIdentify high-priority network needs and translate these into curriculum product refinements and/or additional products to support high quality implementationQualifications Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree strongly preferred 6+ years of work experience in high school education and/or educational publishing6+ years of AP teaching (ideally in English, math, science, or history)Editorial experience with content development, preferably with AP materialsProject management experienceExcellent written and oral communication skillsExceptional interpersonal skills and comfort working closely with teachers, school leaders, and senior leadersLocation The preferred location of this role is our New York office, however exceptional candidates will be considered to work from our Chicago, San Francisco, or Washington, D.C. offices or remotely. This is a full-time, exempt position.The Editorial Director, High School Curriculum must be willing to travel (3-5 days per month) to work with a geographically distributed team and network of regions and schools.Compensation and Benefits We offer a competitive salary, as well as a comprehensive benefits package including: Healthcare (health, vision, and dental) provided at 100% for employees and 75% for dependentsVision is 100% for all dependents401k plan with up to a 4% salary matchGenerous time off: a. PTO starting accrual that equals 18 days a year  b. 15 holidays a year including a three-day Thanksgiving break (Wednesday – Friday) and the last week of the year (December 24 – January 1) And other great benefits! (i.e. gym reimbursement, Flexible spending account (FSA), cell phone reimbursement)

Founded in 1999, ZirMed is the nations only company delivering proven end-to-end cloud-based business and clinical performance management solutions to meet the challenges of managing population health and optimizing fee-for-service and fee-for-value reimbursements. ZirMed combines innovative software development with the industrys most advanced transactional network and predictive analytics platform to improve the business and process of healthcare, give organizations a clearer view of their financial and operational performance, and streamline critical connections between providers, patients, and payers.We're always improving, always testing, always changing, and there's never a dull moment. In the rapidly changing world of healthcare technology, we stay ahead of the curve.What is the purpose of this position?Right now, we are looking for an experienced Contract Analyst who has previously supported healthcare software applications or served in a healthcare contract management role. The Contract Analyst will serve as a business contact for our clients regarding contract management and is responsible for maintaining clients managed care and government contracts. A successful candidate for this Contract Analyst role will establish himself/herself as a trusted advisor and liaison to the client. This positions main responsibility will be to serve as the primary contact for our customers regarding contracts, including implementing new contracts, updating existing contracts, validating contract terms, and addressing any client issues or concerns. An ideal candidate for this position can approach problem-solving challenges independently, a strong attention to detail, enjoys working in a fast-paced, collaborative and team-based environment. Do you fit our team? Responsible for implementing contract terms in ZirMed's Contract Management solutionPerform validation of contract terms by reviewing account examples and confirming correct contract term and expected reimbursement generatedManage the contract workflow to ensure timely and accurate implementation of contractsResponsible for collaborating with client during contract interpretation and validation stagesBachelor degree1 year of contract analyst experience in healthcare software or healthcare consulting environmentAbility to interpret contract language from managed care contractsAbility to interpret regulatory guidelines from CMS, Tricare, and Medicaid websitesAbility to understand the vocabulary used in a hospitals revenue cycle operations, including healthcare coding such as DRGs, CPT/HCPC, Revenue Codes, APG and APCAn in-depth subject matter expertise and dedication to remaining current with industry and/or relevant legislative changes and advancesMust be a quick learner with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environmentOutstanding communication and interpersonal skillsMust possess strong analytical and problem-solving skillsProficient in Microsoft Office applicationsDetail-orientedPrior experience working in a contract management role preferredMust be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer.

About you: You have the rare combination of technical savviness and business acumen and youre looking for a career where you can utilize both. As a Sales Enginer at Twilio, you will hone each of these skills by advising a diverse set of customers on what is possible using Twilios API.  Sales Engineers at Twilio are involved in all stages of the customers software development lifecycle and are comfortable using presentations, email, phone and social media to connect with customers. We are looking for someone who can create sales presentations, product demonstrations, and educate customers (everyone from developers to product managers to C-level executives) on the best ways to utilize cloud communications technology. Twilios Sales Engineers are empowered to come up with creative solutions on the spot so we are looking for someone willing to challenge the status quo and throw out the manual on occasion. Responsibilities:Educate customers on what is possible with Twilio.Articulate and provide value to customers by advising them on the integration points of the Twilio API into their platform.Ability to compare and contrast various providers in the industry, along with how Twilio would stack up and be able to clearly articulate (with experience) the advantages of building versus buying.Understand customer requirements and communicate the business value of solving technology problems using cloud communications technology.Guide the design and deployment of enterprise communications systems that impact multiple functional areas of a customers organization.Create technical content to show customers how to implement specific use cases or best practices for new technologies.Prepare demos and proof of concepts to demonstrate various use cases for Twilios APIs.Distill and communicate customer needs and product feedback to Product Management, Engineering, Marketing and Sales.Document the architectural solutions that customers have designed and deployed for internal use.Requirements:Four or more years in a customer-facing technical role.A strong understanding of the software development lifecycle.Experience in one or more of the following areas: web development, mobile development, IP-based telephony and real-time communications.A firm understanding of enterprise integration best practices, service oriented architecture and models for sharing IT services across the enterprise.A world class communicator. Confident dispensing knowledge to a highly skilled and experienced audience including C-level executives.Typically 10-25% travel, depending on role.Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, MIS or a comparable field is preferred.Bonus Points:Good knowledge base about how to structure and architect web applicationsHow to Apply: Include a link to an application (or two!) that youve built using Twilio. About us: Twilio's mission is to fuel the future of communications. Developers and businesses use Twilio to make communications relevant and contextual by embedding messaging, voice, and video capabilities directly into their software applications. Founded in 2008, Twilio has over 800 employees, with headquarters in San Francisco and other offices in Bogotá, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Madrid, Malmö, Mountain View, Munich, New York City, Singapore and Tallinn. Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. #LI-POST

WE ARE OUTCOME ACTIVATORS We are a health-tech company on a mission to activate the best health outcome possible for every person in the world. WHO ARE YOU You are a dynamic and highly-organized collaborator with experience in keeping legal operations efficient and organized in a fast-paced environment. You will work closely with the Head of Legal, providing executive administrative support, including scheduling and calendar management, travel arrangements, expense report submission and communication management. You will also be responsible for key legal operational tasks, including, drafting and/or proofreading correspondence, filing, obtaining signatures, maintaining meeting minute books, and comparing contracts against approved forms. You will be involved in managing a variety of legal projects and must be willing to roll up your sleeves to tackle any tasks at hand. You have a passion for bringing structure where it does not exist, providing a smooth experience while owning a variety of tasks, and you thrive in a culture of innovation. Experience supporting law firm partners and/or corporate legal departments a plus, but you must also be comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment where the playbook is waiting for you to write it. Integra LifeSciences, a world leader in medical technology, is dedicated to limiting uncertainty for surgeons, so they can concentrate on providing the best patient care. Integra offers innovative solutions in orthopedic extremity surgery, neurosurgery, reconstructive and general surgery, and regenerative wound care.  Integra's orthopedic products include devices and implants for foot and ankle, hand and wrist, shoulder and elbow, tendon and peripheral nerve protection and repair. Integra is a leader in neurosurgery, offering a broad portfolio of implants, devices, instruments and systems used in neurosurgery, neuromonitoring, neurotrauma, and related critical care. Integra’s Tissue Technologies is an in-patient and outpatient Regenerative product portfolio, which includes products for wound care, burns, abdominal reconstruction, and plastic & reconstructive surgery. In the United States, Integra is a leading provider of surgical instruments to hospitals, surgery centers and alternate care sites, including physician and dental offices.  Founded in 1989 Integra is headquartered in Plainsboro, New Jersey and has over 3,300 employees worldwide. Integra's common stock is listed on The NASDAQ Stock Market under the symbol "IART." and nurturing meaningful business relationships over the phone and emailExperience with technology and internet deployed servicesProficiency in use of Salesforce.comCOMPANY DESCRIPTION: At VelocityEHS we’re all about helping companies around the world promote a safer work environment for their employees. We develop innovative on-demand (cloud-computing technology) safety and compliance management solutions that enable our customers, environmental health and safety (EH&S) professionals in a wide range of industries, to work faster and more cost-effectively in administering their overall safety compliance programs.  Headquartered in the heart of downtown Chicago, VelocityEHS is much more than just a place to work. VelocityEHS has cultivated a unique environment where success is both a journey and an everyday occurrence. We work hard and play hard because we love what we do. We place a high value on teamwork, and at the same time, look for individuals who are self-motivated and willing to take risk to help the company advance.  VelocityEHS offers many benefits, including: paid time off, health/dental insurance, 401(K) plan, casual dress, transit benefit program and more. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace. Base salary + uncapped incentive pay program + full benefits.To apply, please follow the link below: https://recruiting.ultipro.com/MSD1000MSDS/JobBoard/1f9339ba-2d37-44eb-813d-06683cb57987/OpportunityDetail?opportunityId=45a43e57-0ff4-4b3b-a49f-52724b60c39aABOUT VelocityEHS VelocityEHS is a trusted supplier of EHS Management Information Systems (EMIS) to global manufacturing, energy, mining, biotech, food service, and transportation companies ranging in size from a hundred to over half a million employees.  The VelocityEHS Software Suite helps companies operate more sustainably, safely, and efficiently. By focusing on a rich and intuitive end user experience VelocityEHS has developed an unparalleled record of user acceptance and implementation success. VelocityEHS enables companies to reduce injuries, increase the effectiveness of regulatory compliance initiatives, perform audits and inspections, manage greenhouse gas reporting, and initiate or improve corporate sustainability programs. VelocityEHS Core Goals Our workplace engages each of us to realize company and individual growth goalsOur customer experience lifecycle creates a community of advocatesOur product delights users and improves how they do their jobsOur financial performance enables us to realize our vision At VelocityEHS, our values shape and influence all of our decisions and actions. These core values are demonstrated by all employees and contribute directly to results related to: Product and Quality, Customer Experience, People, Business Development, Operations and growth.  Interested candidates are requested to submit a resume, cover letter, and salary expectations through careers@ehs.com. Salary is commensurate with experience.  We are an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties. VelocityEHS encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Our company has a great record of accommodating persons with disabilities. Contact us through careers@ehs.com, if you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies. We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies please.

Sales Associate05/16/2017*Hiring now for future dates in January 2018THE OPPORTUNITY: We are seeking a talented, money motivated individual who is looking to establish or build upon a career in territory sales. Our Mid-Market Associates are responsible for supporting the day to day activity of our Territory Account Team with a focus on increasing market share within the Mid-Market segment, specifically within a specific geographic territory. Mid-Market Associates drive revenue by carrying out strategic campaign initiatives that take a consultative selling approach towards understanding the customer’s needs and guiding the customer to the appropriate VelocityEHS solution. In working with our team of Territory Account Representatives to close accounts, Mid-Market Associates will learn and contribute to all aspects of the sales process which includes but is not limited to: creating sales and marketing plans, prospecting, selling value, setting up and participating in web-based presentations and creating proposals and contracts.  The ideal candidate will possess a positive attitude, enthusiasm, great people skills, a willingness to learn and an ability to articulate a value proposition. We use a team approach, combined with one-on-one education to bring out the best in people. A technical sales background is not a prerequisite; we will train the right person.
