JOB REQUIREMENTS: EMT's & Paramedics Must be able to Lift in excess of a minimum of 150 lbs. Must be able to perform all essential job functions of an EMT/Paramedic lifting/moving patients, bending, squatting, sitting, pushing & pulling a stretcher etc. in addition to all medical functions as licensed by the State of Illinois Department of Public Health. Must be willing to submit to a Pre-employment drug screening. Must be willing to attend all company mandated orientations, training's & meetings. Must keep State Licensure Current with the hospital system we are associated with as well as in good standing with the State of Illinois Department of Public Health which includes staying current with mandated CE & Certifications. Must comply with all company policies & procedures. The EMT & Paramedic job function is to transport sick and injured persons by ambulance in a manner conducive to their safety and comfort and to administer Basic Life Support & Advanced Life Support pre-hospital care and treatment within the limits defined by the State of Illinois law and Elite Ambulance Medical Director & limitations defined by their license level. We are looking for FULL & PART Time Paramedics & EMT’s Multiple locations including: Northern Suburbs, Southern Suburbs & Western Suburbs. Paramedics & EMT’s:· Must possess a valid EMT-B or EMT-P license issued by IDPH.· Current Health Care Provider CPR Card.· Valid Illinois Driver License & clean driving record.· Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screening.· Must be willing to attend company approved driving course & training.· Competitive Pay.· Holiday Pay.· Flexible scheduling (will work with school schedule etc.)Apply online at www.EliteAmb.netElite Ambulance is an Equal Opportunity Employer

job_title: NEC and Microsoft Accessories Brand Manager
description: Description The Brand Manager is the central liaison for the partner for working with CDW stakeholders across the organization, including sales, finance, and marketing. This position is responsible for driving revenue, profitability and awareness for their respective partner while engaging CDW partners across Partner and Product Management, Sales and Marketing. The Brand Manager interacts with senior level management regarding program development and pricing, while taking significant direction from a Category Manager.Key Areas of ResponsibilityBe the subject matter expert in a partner's product line and associated programs such as Bid Desk programs and Category PenetrationAnalyze industry information to identify opportunities and develop strategies to increase salesDevelop go-to-market strategies that outline target customer segments, products, promotions, pricing, positioning and complete launch plansEducate pre-sales and Product Specialists on new product introductions, transitions, competitive advantages, and opportunities to identify sales within their customer baseUnderstand and communicate partner organizational structure with key decision makers and foster relationships with senior managementCommunicate partners’ financial conditions and market new products related to the assigned partnerEngage daily with assigned partner to maintain an open channel of communication at all times to ensure that all CDW and partner stakeholders are kept up to date on any and all issues, initiatives, projects, meetings, or conferencesManage and maximize overall profitability; managing financial benefits and develop a strategy around re-investing funding ResponsibilitiesEngage with CDW Procurement to help forecast sales volumesRepresent the assigned brand in meetings and speak to brand performance, category performance, program/promotion results, and current initiativesProvide comprehensive reporting both internally and externally on brand performance, category performance, industry trends, and market shareHost Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) to review partner performance and discuss joint initiativesAssist the Product Specialists in creation and review of content for respective manufacturer adsObtain and facilitate necessary partner and industry certificationsQualifications Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree + 2 years sales/marketing experience, OR6 years experience in sales/marketing, OR4 years CDW PPM experience + 2 years experience in sales/marketing Other Required QualificationsExcellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with all stakeholdersProficient in Microsoft Office applicationsDemonstrated financial and business acumenAbility to think strategically and analyze informationStrong willingness to learn Preferred QualificationsBachelor’s degree with a concentration in MarketingPrevious experience in the technology industryPrior experience in Supply Chain, Pricing, Merchandising or Program Management

Description The Senior Brand Manager is the central liaison for large, top tier, and more complex partners for working with CDW stakeholders across the organization, including sales, finance, and marketing. The Senior Brand Manager is the product expert and business manager. This role acts as the channel leader and provides guidance to respective Partners, identifying opportunities and developing strategies to increase product sales. The Senior Brand Manager is responsible for driving revenue, profitability and awareness for respective manufacture while engaging heavily with Sales. Company Description ThreatConnect, Inc. is the leading provider of advanced threat intelligence products and services including ThreatConnect®, the most comprehensive Threat Intelligence Platform (TIP) on the market. ThreatConnect delivers a single platform in the cloud and on-premises to effectively aggregate, analyze, and act to counter sophisticated cyber-attacks. Leveraging advanced analytics capabilities ThreatConnect offers a superior understanding of relevant cyber threats to business operations. To register for a free ThreatConnect account, or to learn more about our products and services, visit: www.threatconnect.com. Job Description We are looking for an experienced Senior Sales Engineer that can hit the ground running in a fast-paced and quickly growing environment. ThreatConnect SEs provide pre-sales support and guidance to customers, and collaborate with Area Directors to recommend and develop appropriate customer platform offerings. The SE is a trusted advisor and is looked to as an expert in implementing ThreatConnect’s Intelligence Platform and Security Orchestration products. SE Roles and Responsibilities:Provide pre-sales assistance for sales opportunities to customers.Build, deploy, configure, and troubleshoot ThreatConnect instances, and required integrations, as part of the customer evaluation processDevelop customer use-cases and lead white-board discussions in face-to-face settings with Security teams involving ThreatConnect’s Threat Intelligence Platform and Orchestration products.Educate customers on the technical capabilities/features of the platform and research customer specific requirements to ensure alignment Educate the customer on Threat Analysis best practices and methodology leveraging ThreatConnect ResearchRespond to requests for proposal and information in both oral and written formats: RFQs, RFIs, etc.Act as an interface between the Sales organization and technical staff to resolve technical issues related to evaluations and/or customer requirementsProvide feedback on opportunities and field activities to Sales, Product Management and EngineeringDevelop playbooks leveraging ThreatConnect’s orchestration capabilityRequirementsQualifications Candidate must be based in Chicago or nearby regionBachelor or Masters Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline OR equivalent experience with 10+ years pre-sales experience in the computer security industryStrong working knowledge of Linux administration, configuration & networking.Be able to configure and troubleshoot Linux, Java and Python application environments. Development or scripting in shell, JavaScript or Python is a big plus.Experience in working with VMs - building, maintaining, managing proof of concepts.Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to present to a variety of external audiences, including being able to interact with senior executivesExceptional written communication. Company Description ThreatConnect, Inc. is the leading provider of advanced threat intelligence products and services including ThreatConnect®, the most comprehensive Threat Intelligence Platform (TIP) on the market. ThreatConnect delivers a single platform in the cloud and on-premises to effectively aggregate, analyze, and act to counter sophisticated cyber-attacks. Leveraging advanced analytics capabilities ThreatConnect offers a superior understanding of relevant cyber threats to business operations. To register for a free ThreatConnect account, or to learn more about our products and services, visit: www.threatconnect.com. Job Description We are looking for an experienced Senior Sales Engineer that can hit the ground running in a fast-paced and quickly growing environment. ThreatConnect SEs provide pre-sales support and guidance to customers, and collaborate with Area Directors to recommend and develop appropriate customer platform offerings. The SE is a trusted advisor and is looked to as an expert in implementing ThreatConnect’s Intelligence Platform and Security Orchestration products. Development or scripting in shell, JavaScript or Python is a big plus.Experience in working with VMs - building, maintaining, managing proof of concepts.Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to present to a variety of external audiences, including being able to interact with senior executivesExceptional written communication. Summary: Responsible for assisting in plan compliance initiatives and programs. Performs or assists in quality investigations, assists in evaluating, implementing and following up on quality systems in support of plan compliance. Provides support for collection and analysis of data in support of coordinating assessment analysis to ensure that the plan is under an acceptable level of compliance.Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.Supports departments by collecting and coordinating internal compliance data with various departments.Provides administration support by implementing systems, procedures, and policies; completing projects in support of compliance audits.Assist with the preparation, distribution, and preparation of required compliance reports, submissions, etc. to regulatory entities as requested.Support the review process for all corporate policies and procedures as requested.Assist with internal and external audits conducted by or through the Compliance Department. Gathers, reviews, and analyzes data required for such audits.Assist with the follow-up related to these audits, including internal reporting, monitoring, and facilitating corrective action plans and process improvements.Facilitate the development of compliance programs in conjunction with the Compliance Officer and the Compliance CommitteeParticipate in the complaint resolution process.Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree required; post-graduate degree preferred, Minimum 1-3 years previous healthcare compliance related experience, preferably with some demonstrated skill in compliance auditing, investigations, policy & procedure development, or related. Refer Save ApplyJob ID: SS-1018895  Description: BASIC FUNCTION:As a member of the Enterprise Architecture Services team, you will be at the forefront of systems architecture definition and implementation (including applications, data and technology domains) for any one or more of our business technology portfolios. Enabling our business processes with new and innovative ways to deliver services and value to our customers will require someone with the ability totranslate business requirements into specific systems, applications or process designs for very large, complex IT solutions. This person will need to be a respected leader who works well with others, has enough charisma to influence and guide others in challenging situations, and is motivated by long-term results while addressing short-term needs. REQUIRED JOB REQUIREMENTS:*Bachelor Degree in related technical / business areas or equivalent work experience*10+ years technical experience in multiple, diverse technologies and processing environments including 4 years of technology architecture experience*Comfortable in more than one programming language and has a firm grasp of fundamental web, internet, and mobile technologies*Understands all domains of architecture and applies that knowledge to create solution architectures to solve complex business problems that have a broad impact on the business*Experience defining and negotiating solution options while considering risks, costs, and impact on the enterprise business processes and goals*Exceptional interpersonal skills, including teamwork, facilitation and communication*Able to mentor others as needed PREFERRED JOB REQUIREMENTS:*Experience in the healthcare insurance industry preferred*Experience delivering solutions using an Agile/Scrum methodology*Experience applying enterprise integration patterns using SOA, API’s, microservices, message-based, and file-based approaches*Experience with applying data integration patterns using traditional and modern data technologies (SQL, NoSQL)*A keen understanding on how security controls are positioned and how they relate to the overall systems architecture*CALI-POST*CB*  “As the health care industry continues to rapidly transform, our IT team conceives, develops and delivers impactful technology solutions to support access to quality, affordable health care for our members. We are driven by our collective company purpose: To do everything in our power to stand with our members in sickness and in health®. Our IT team unleashes the power of this purpose through technology. We come to work every day to make a difference, and we deliver the highest quality and best solutions to our members.” HCSC is committed to diversity in the workplace and to providing equal opportunity and affirmative action to employees and applicants. We are an Equal Opportunity Employment / Affirmative Action employer dedicated to workforce diversity and a drug-free and smoke-free workplace. Drug screening and background investigation are required, as allowed by law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.Requirements: Expertise  Information Technology Information Technology Job Type  Full-Time Regular Full-Time Regular Location  IL - Chicago, TX - Richardson IL - Chicago, TX - Richardson

We are seeking a Senior Manager, Project Management to join our Projects Team in Chicago. The Team Our Projects team handles complex, challenging, and high-profile projects for Fortune 500 companies who are undergoing regulatory changes, mergers, spin-offs, or legacy contract review. The team is full of engaging project managers who have a passion for efficiency, technology, and, occasionally, karaoke. The Role This individual will manage, implement, and oversee large-scale, complex projects as well as multiple, smaller-scale projects for our Fortune 500 clients across a span of industries, with an emphasis on financial services & banking, as well as consumer, manufacturing, health & life sciences, and energy.  To accomplish these goals, the Senior Manager will work directly with clients to ensure the success of our projects and lead internal teams to a successful outcome. This includes overseeing a robust team in a matrixed environment by providing coaching, feedback, performance reviews, and, of course, sage advice.  The Senior Manager will also be the point of contact for internal Axiom stakeholders and will provide updates, track internal progress, and liaise with business teams regarding new projects and industry trends.  This is truly a great opportunity for an adept problem solver with excellent client relationship skills to drive innovation in a rapidly changing legal environment. The legal landscape is on a precipice of change, and Axiom is very much at the forefront of this movement. Join us. Responsibilities :Developing and managing a project planConducting resource planningIdentifying risks and issues and developing appropriate mitigation plansProactively managing and monitoring execution of deliverables and statusManaging critical path, dependencies, and contingenciesEnsuring the project stakeholders' expectations are understood and managed, and ensuring that the project team follows all quality assurance processesWorking in conjunction with the Axiom Practice Management team, building client understanding, confidence, and enthusiastic acceptance for proposed solutions, resulting in Axiom winning the proposed workContributing to building Axiom’s proprietary Intellectual Property in the rapidly changing Managed Contracts Services business area.Operating within a collaborative environment with highly motivated colleagues and interacting with all parts of the business, including Attorney Hiring & Professional Development and all corporate functions, such as marketing, finance, HR, & ITLeading and contributing to altering and developing new internal workflows to accommodate new service offerings. This position will be based in Chicago and the individual in this role will be expected to travel based on the needs of the business. Experience & QualificationsIdeally 7+ years of client service and problem solving leadership within a leading bank, consulting, or accounting firmSignificant project management experience and meticulous attention to detailRelentless focus on client needs and desire to consistently raise the bar on service excellenceSuperb time management, judgment, decision-making and problem solving skillsThrives in both individual and collaborative team environmentsExpert high-impact communication and presentation skillsProficiency with the Microsoft Office suite, including PowerPoint and Excel; MS Project experience highly recommendedOrganizational fit for the Axiom culture, that is, exhibit the core values of Irresistible, Fresh, Committed, & ThoughtfulLegally eligible to work in the country in which the position is locatedEducationJDMBA and/or LPC/IPLS preferredPMP preferredBachelor’s degree required As a member of an ISO Compliant center, the candidate will be required to follow the policies and procedures on Information Security Management System in place at the Chicago Center and globally at Axiom. As a member of the Axiom team, the applicant will have access to various company and client assets and will be required to maintain the level of security as identified for each asset.

Description The Sr. Inside Solution Architect-Unified Communications supports Account Managers by assisting them in the sale of solutions related to Unified Communications. The Sr. Inside Solution Architect-Unified Communications builds relationships and educates Account Managers on the technologies, resources, and pricing programs available to them.  The Sr. Inside Solution Architect-Unified Communications develops and maintains strategic relationships with Sales Management of the teams they support and seen as a trusted advisor to grow business.  The Sr. Inside Solution Architect-Unified Communications is expected to be subject matter expert in multiple families of Unified Communications solutions.  Key Areas of Responsibility Technology Leadership:Educates Account Managers by conducting short training classes on Unified Communications productsExplains the features, benefits, and technical specifications of new secondary, emerging and complementary products and solutionsExplains conceptually how secondary and emerging/add-on products and solutions are installed and implemented for customersDesigns solutions for secondary and emerging/complementary products and solutionsExpert level knowledge of multiple Unified Communications categories inclusive of vertical specific needsReadily shares lessons learned and technical knowledge with other Inside Solution Architects and Account Managers regarding primary, secondary, emerging, and complementary products and solutionsAnswers questions and assists less experienced team members on using the tools of the jobKeeps abreast of changes and trendsAttain role level certificationsSales Support:Consults with customers and partners to architect solutionsFollows up and responds to questions regarding registrations and closed deals, and escalation needsMonitors and renews service maintenance contractsTracks sales leads, manages sales pipeline from lead to closure for sales over segment thresholdRegisters and manages customer proposals in partner registration systemsProduces quotes and BOMsCreates quotes for high priority RFPs and/or assists with RFP contentProduces sales forecast reportsReviews quotes and orders for accuracySales:Discusses solutions at a conceptual level with customers and potential customersExplains the solutions features and benefitsRecommends and influences the client to include services that complement hardware/software proposalsExplains the financial metrics that the solution achieves and use various tools to calculate the ROI for the customerGuides customers in their decision making (compares and contrasts) primary, secondary, emerging, and complementary technologiesLeads CDW events on business-focused technology solution presentations for customers and prospects delivered via web-based tools (e.g. WebEx, Lync) and in personExplores additional sales opportunities through new service maintenance contracts and renewalsNegotiates pricing with partners and customersRoutinely collaborates with Partners and Account Managers to drive mapped opportunities, fine tune strategies and approaches to exceed joint sales goalsDevelops detailed Territory Plan to manage their businessRegularly engages with key customers to build and nurture a trusted advisor relationship. Develops a strategy collaboratively with the customer and account managerQualificationsMinimum Qualifications:Associate’s Degree or equivalent work experience 2-year experience as ISA or 3-year minimum equivalent experienceOther Required Qualifications:Proficient in Microsoft office applications Ability to travel up to 20% of the time Proven success and experience selling technologies solutions and services Knowledge and proven success of engaging and working with sales teams Ability to execute on territory goals and metrics Ability to adapt and change to the business needs of the practice and team coverage model Strong interpersonal and presentation skills, including consulting skills Strong oral and written communication skills Strong passion for learning and teaching others Proven group presentations skills Motivated and self-starting Ability to think creatively and come up with proactive ideas that will increase sales Strong problem solving skills Must be able to communicate effectively and in a constructive manner with management, peers and coworkersPreferred Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree Proven success and experience selling technologies solutions and services to small business, enterprise or global customers Technical Accreditations and/or Certifications: Active accreditation from leading Unified Communications partners Successfully completed ISA accreditations

Safety Coordinator  SUPPORT SAFETY PROGRAMS AND PRACTICES FOR A PROJECT Holder Construction Company, an Atlanta based commercial construction company with operations throughout the United States, is seeking a highly motivated Safety Coordinator to join our project teams in Atlanta, GA. Primary Responsibilities:Assist with executing our safety strategy and zero accident culture on the project(s)Monitoring daily construction activities for compliance with OSHA and company rules/policiesImplement the project’s safety programTeach onsite safety classes including fall protection, excavation & confined space, scaffolding, electrical, OSHA-10 and OSHA-30 hourRequirements for this position include:5 years of commercial construction safety experienceFormal safety training including OSHA 500 in the construction industry and training in scaffolding, crane management, steel erection, emergency response, fall management, excavation and confined space, rigging, hazardous waste and NFPDS/erosion controlAbility to identify and correct safety deficiencies in the fieldPossess excellent interpersonal skills, with demonstrated ability to effectively interact with employees at all levels in a construction environmentCandidate must also be proficient with Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel, and PowerPointExperience with a general contractor preferred Ideal candidate will also have a Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Safety Management and professional safety certifications (e.g. CSP, CHSP).  Since 1960, Holder Construction Company’s mission to provide clients with quality construction services has resulted in over 80% repeat client business. Holder is a national construction services firm respected as a leader in “team approach” project delivery. It consistently ranks as one of the Nation’s top 100 contractors. We are a performance based company with an excellent career development program. We offer a top notch compensation and benefits package which includes health, life, dental, vision, flexible spending program, long term disability, family paid time off and a 401(k) retirement plan. Our dynamic company culture provides associates with an environment that encourages teamwork, continuous improvement, and performance based advancement.  Please note that Holder Construction Company does not sponsor anyone for immigration benefits or immigration status.  Holder is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in employment. EEO-AAP Background screen and substance abuse testing is a condition of employment.

We offer a top notch compensation and benefits package which includes health, life, dental, vision, flexible spending program, long term disability, family paid time off and a 401(k) retirement plan. Our dynamic company culture provides associates with an environment that encourages teamwork, continuous improvement, and performance based advancement.  Please note that Holder Construction Company does not sponsor anyone for immigration benefits or immigration status.  Holder is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in employment. EEO-AAP Background screen and substance abuse testing is a condition of employment.

job_title: Sr. Associate, Digital Marketing - Paid Social
description: Welcome!Hungry for a new venture? Grubhub is the nation's leading online and mobile food ordering company, dedicated to connecting hungry diners with their favorite local restaurants. The people who work at Grubhub are our company's greatest asset; each person at Grubhub plays an integral part in building tools and technology that help restaurants succeed, and in cooking up fresh new ways to delight our diners.  The company’s online and mobile ordering platforms allow diners to order directly from more than 55,000 takeout restaurants in over 1,100 U.S. cities and London. The Grubhub portfolio of brands includes Grubhub, Seamless, AllMenus, and MenuPages.  We want you to enjoy where you work, who you work with and what you work on. At Grubhub, you can order your cake and eat it too!The Sr. Associate of Digitial Marketing, Paid Social supports the social efforts at Grubhub across CRM, customer acquisition and brand. When taking on this role, your focus will be to drive customer acquisition, improve order frequency and support brand initiatives through social ads. In applying for this role, you should come from a strategic and analytical background with a keen understanding of social ad networks like Facebook and Facebook-owned properties. You should be knowledgeable in staying ahead of trends, and also possess a deep-rooted passion for social media and how it can be used to drive meaningful business results.Day to day management of sequential paid social marketing programs that drive users throughout the customer lifecycleServe as social platform subject matter expert - understanding trends and working with teams to implement findings into strategies quickly and efficientlyWork cross functionally with acquisition and CRM teams to grow new customer base and to increase order frequency among existing diners through social adsPartner with Brand to understand an editorial calendar and content flow, and to ensure that a promotion plan and strategy is in place for always on/ evergreen contentDevelop retention, loyalty, re-engagement plans to keep current diners activeBuild out new campaigns based on learnings and opportunities for growth across social channelsContinuously execute A/B tests to improve performance of this channelWork with existing social teams to identify campaign elements essential for successPartnering with designers to ensure creative assets are optimized for performanceWork closely with channel partners including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, etc. to deeply understand ad platforms and identify opportunities for Grubhub to be a first-mover in the space3-5 years experience in digital marketing with a focus on social adsExperience creating large scale PPC and direct response campaigns with multi-million dollar budgetsPower user capability in ExcelA proven track record driving positive financial results for large scale social ad programsExperience using Facebook Power EditorExperience using 3rd party social ad management platformsExperience running multiple tests simultaneously and have the ability to optimize performance of messaging/techniquesAbility to analyze campaign performance and understand how to turn insights into actionsGot These? Even Better:Familiar with Google Analytics and AtlasExperience with SQLHave managed marketing campaigns for businesses with a local focusUnlimited paid vacation days. Choose how your time is spentNever go hungry! We provide weekly Grubhub/Seamless creditRegular in-office social events, including happy hours, wine tastings, karaoke, bingo with prizes and moreCompany-Wide Initiatives encouraging innovation, continuous learning and cross-department connections We deliver favorites every day. Join us as we move eating forward. Grubhub is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here: DOL Poster. If you are applying for a job in the U.S. and need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@grubhub.com and let us know the nature of your request and contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address.

If you are looking for a fun company right in the center of River North, with great company culture, the ability to really learn sales, no overtime hours, and the opportunity for growth and advancement, than look no further!! Sales University Group is seeking confident and highly motivated individuals with 0-3 years of experience to join our fast growing team. We offer thorough sales training and ongoing education. This is the ideal opportunity for recent college graduates who are seeking a way to break into the sales world, or for those with a couple years of prior sales experience.  Sales University Group (SUG) drives revenue growth by providing lead generation and outsourced sales solutions to help our clients increase sales. Our role in the sales process is very simple - our clients focus on running their business - we focus on generating opportunities to help them increase their sales pipelines. We recruit, hire, onboard, train and develop ambitious professionals who show the aptitude and passion for having a career in sales. We provide the training, technology, and environment to ensure our team members are successful selling our clients' products and services.  We typically start Inside Sales Representatives at a $35,000 base salary, plus commission, (which we estimate to be $5,000-$10,000) for a total of $40,000-$45,000 in the first year. However, top performers can enable opportunities for advancement usually within 12-18 months. The role is an inside sales position primarily focused on the development of new business for our clients, that you will be partnered with during various initiatives. Desired Skills and Experience:Bachelor's Degree required.0-3 years of experience.Must demonstrate a desire to learn, embrace new concepts, and be passionate about leveraging the phone to drive opportunity.Display professional persistence.Inside sales or outbound calling experience a plus.We are open to those with no prior cold calling experience as long as you have the right personality and attitude.Outgoing, determined, positive, and coachable.Great listener with the ability to deliver a clear message over the phone.Likes to work in a fun team environment.Due to the rapid growth of Sales University Group, we are looking to hire ASAP and would love to hear from you!

Location:ChicagoCompany Description:​Yello’s talent acquisition software enables companies to humanize the candidate experience by providing unprecedented speed and transparency throughout the candidate journey. Founded in 2008, Yello supports hundreds of organizations globally by serving as a key strategic partner in optimizing recruiting operations and talent relationship management.  In 2017, Yello closed a series C funding round of $31 million and continues to grow quickly. We’re looking to hire people who believe nothing is impossible, love to learn and be curious, can be accountable for success, always enjoy the journey and will own their personality. If this is you, come grow your career with Yello.About The Role:Yello is a venture-backed technology startup in hyper-growth. We’re hiring high performing sales professionals to help us scale our SaaS business in the enterprise space. Our founders are proven entrepreneurs and customers love our products. Our sales leaders joined Yello from premier companies because they saw the opportunity to drive massive top line growth for many years ahead. On the Yello account management team, you get to play a key role in building relationships, learn how to scale relationships, and be part of a collaborative, high-performing sales team.How You'll Make An Impact:As an Enterprise SaaS Account Manager managing our Enterprise Accounts, you will be responsible for all aspects of relationship management and customer success planning, strategically partnering with Yello’s Customers to understand Client’s business initiatives and challenges, in efforts to enable Clients to derive value through use of Yello’s solutions and services. You will manage post-sales contact with signed client base in order to facilitate a positive and proactive long-term relationship and ensure customer loyalty. You will focus on continued solution optimization, with underlying intent of improving customer usage, through use of best-practices to manage and grow this segment of our customer base. The Account Manager will be evaluated based on contract renewal attainment, and overall growth of the portfolio. Additionally, the AM will develop and negotiate enterprise level proposals and contracts, accurately forecast sales activity through proper use of sales tools, and create and deliver customized sales presentations and lead high-impact meetings. Finally, you will collaborate effectively and engage various pre/post sales resources including Sales Development Representatives, Solutions Consultants, as well as Legal, Security, and Customer Success. This position will manage a portfolio of accounts located in the USA. What We're Looking For:A bachelor's degree and relevant experience is requiredMust have prior experience in enterprise account management, enterprise application sales (i.e. carrying a quota)Must have a proven ability in managing complex sales cycles from start to finish with a track record of successful quota attainmentYou must be able to effectively renew all assigned accounts with favorable terms and conditionsYou can demonstrate expansion of the Yello.co solutions beyond the functionality introduced during implementation process and consistently seek new business opportunities by presenting and recommending new Yello.co products and serviceYou are able to position Yello.co's value proposition as part of our overall business solutions, linking these benefits back to the key business issues of the clientYou pride your self on your ability to develop and maintain extraordinary relationship with assigned existing clients to ensure their satisfaction and retention while helping to grow our incremental revenue.You maintain accurate and timely customer, pipeline and forecast dataIndustry experience (HCM, Recruiting) or with the Yello.co solution would be a huge plus What You Can Expect From Us:The Account Manager is a sales role for professionals who want to get on the ground floor of a tech startup in hyper-growth, learn the business, see their fingerprints on meaningful deals that bring impactful dollars to the company and receive coaching to develop sales and professional skills in an atmosphere where rapid professional growth is supported. This is a very rare opportunity to be part of building a team that will be critical to quickly scaling sales at a company with an impressive client list, inspiring revenue growth and an amazing culture. Additional Information:We are the trailblazers in our space and we continually strive to learn and grow, but there is always time to celebrate a colleague's birthday or a recent success. We dress casually, have one of the best views in the city and the whole team sports Apple laptops. Our CEO Jason Weingarten and President Dan Bartfield always have their office doors open. And with opportunities for professional advancement, medical, dental and vision insurance, and a 401K match – Yello has you covered.Yello is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.Candidates local to Chicago are preferred.You must be authorized to work in the United States, full-time, for any employer.Must be able to sit or stand for continuous periods of timeThis role frequently communicates/interacts with individuals, must have strong written and oral communication skillsYello reserves the right to assign or reassign the responsibilities and requirements to this job at any time

Marketing and Sales Operations Redwood Logistics is a privately held, strategically integrated logistics provider founded in 2001. Through our history we’ve listened to our customers’ needs and have created a family of companies that can solve their logistics and transportation challenges. See for yourself why The Chicago Tribune has named Redwood Logistics a Top Workplace for several years running! Position Description: As Marketing and Sales Operations, you will primarily provide support to Redwood’s Strategic Sales team by performing a number of administrative and creative tasks to enable more efficient and effective strategic selling. Responsibilities:Develop and inventory professional, targeted, and effective sales presentations for sales staff review prior to delivery to customerManage and organize calendar for sales team, including customer meetings and other travelManage company social media pages; manage individual social media pages for the VP and Executive level as requestedRun scheduled reports on pipeline activity for sales management and follow up with customer and/or sales rep as neededMaintain CRM databaseResearch industry conferences/seminars/speaking opportunities and provide recommendation for attendance based on opportunity/cost; organize attendance and track spend/ROIMaintains current on industry trends, company and competitor activityRuns scheduled reports on pipeline activity for sales management as requestedQualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Marketing strongly preferredMinimum 2 years experience in Marketing or Sales Support roleProficiency with Microsoft products required, including Microsoft Office (events, calendars, tasks); advanced PowerPoint and Excel userEffective oral/written communication skillsStrong organizational and planning skillsFlexibility to adjust priority with changing business needs 1765 N Elston, Suite 301  Chicago, Illinois, 60642  United States

SteelSeries is looking for a Software Engineer in Test - Intern to help develop world class gaming products. We are looking for someone that will play an important role in our product development and has a serious passion for gaming, technology, and software development. Why should you work here:Love what you do With all due respect to the other industries out there, the gaming industry is the best. At the very least, it is the most fun by definition. If you are interested in consumer electronics, gaming, or anything in between - you will be working with the stuff you love.Make an impact - We are a small company, and every voice is heard. We understand that great ideas and important feedback can come from anyone, so if you like being able to make an impact on a daily basis - this is your place. Everyone has chances to see how consumer electronics products are built and what goes into bringing them to market.What we are looking for in our Software Engineer in Test - Intern:A background (either a degree or an education in progress) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related fieldSome experience in multiple languages like Ruby, Python, C++, Java, or C#Some experience with test automation tools and testing processesTechnical knowledge of and years of experience working with computersAbility to follow directions, learn processes, work independently with efficiencyA strong sense of ownership with tasks givenExperience with or knowledge of aspects of testing (bug submission, reproducing issues and documenting workflows, automated regression testing) Unlike most other Software Engineer in Test positions in the gaming industry, our products arent just about software. Since were a peripheral manufacturer, you will become familiar with some of the challenges presented with testing on a wide range of levels, from low level firmware to user acceptance. If you were here the last few months, you would have worked on:Challenging problems in testing: automating functional tests across multiple platforms and operating systems, configuration of our build pipelines and continuous integration servers, building and maintaining tests at every level of our applications, from the web down through the firmware of our individual products.The development of automated testing utilizing Behavior Driven Development frameworks such as Cucumber or SpecFlowBuilding new testing applications that automate testing device FW (usually in C++)Working with our devs, testers, designers, and analysts to build great softwareManually testing aspects of upcoming products and how they interact with the latest software buildAct as the second line of support for customer service tickets - tickets that are more technical (software and firmware) related issuesAbout us SteelSeries makes high performance gaming gear used by the most demanding, top professional gamers worldwide and peripherals that provide superior quality and a competitive edge to gamers of all skill levels.  What originally began with two people who recognized the need for superior, high-quality/performance gaming gear that would give gamers a competitive edge, has grown into a global leader in gaming and entertainment gear sought after for their high performance capabilities.  Fast-forward to today, and weve come a long way since our first glass mouse pad. We have global offices in North America, Europe, and Asia, providing an integrated portfolio of products designed specifically for gaming. Apply if:You are smart and can get stuff done.You are thorough, self-driven, and patient.You take pride in what you do and want to be part of that next great product sitting (hopefully) on the shelf at your local Best Buy or Walmart.You are accustomed to a small company environment.You want a career in software development, computer engineering or something related.Dont apply if:You require strict organizational structure.You dont like computers.You dont play well with others.You generate an unusually high amount of static electricity. We offer a great work place with people who are passionate about gaming and technology. Sorry, we cant do any visa sponsorship or relocation/housing compensation at this time. This position is located in our office in downtown Chicago.

What You'll DoThe selected candidate will be part of a team that builds and supports custom, enterprise-wide, Web-based applications for our clients. In this position, the candidate will experience the full lifecycle of application development in an energetic and professional team environment.ResponsibilitesThe primary function of this position is to design, build, deploy, and support enterprise-wide, Web-based applications for our global clients by performing the following duties:Design, code, and implement new systems using a variety of technologies.Implement bug fixes and enhancements on existing systems.Ensure system quality by performing unit and full system testing.Provide user support as needed.Document system requirements as needed.What You'll NeedTo succeed in this challenging role, candidates should possess the following characteristics:Development experience utilizing Java/J2EE or C#/.NETExperience with one or more RDBMS (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL)Experience with client-side technologies: HTML/XHTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAXExperience or exposure to any of the following is a plus: .NET, Apache Tomcat, Hibernate, Struts, Spring, Velocity, Crystal Reports, SQL Server Reporting Services, Linux, Liferay, Microsoft SharePointAbility to work as part of a small teamAbility to support existing systems and interact with end usersAbility to quickly learn and implement new technologiesStrong work ethic and ability to meet strict deadlinesStrong verbal and written communications skillsThe right candidate is a:Driven learner who loves researching new technologiesWell educated and experienced technologist who can function throughout the entire technical stackBusiness minded professional who understands how to transform business needs into technical solutionsCollaborative Engineer who is able to work independently or as part of a small teamStrong verbal and written communicator with the ability to interface directly with clientsHow to reach us:Email your resume to Abigail.Baker@echelonllc.comWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

What You'll DoThe selected candidate will be part of a team that builds and supports custom, enterprise-wide, Web-based applications for our clients. In this position, the candidate will experience the full lifecycle of application development in an energetic and professional team environment.ResponsibilitesThe primary function of this position is to design, build, deploy, and support enterprise-wide, Web-based applications for our global clients by performing the following duties:Design, code, and implement new systems using a variety of technologies.Implement bug fixes and enhancements on existing systems.Ensure system quality by performing unit and full system testing.Provide user support as needed.Document system requirements as needed.What You'll NeedTo succeed in this challenging role, candidates should possess the following characteristics:Development experience utilizing Java/J2EE or C#/.NETExperience with one or more RDBMS (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL)Experience with client-side technologies: HTML/XHTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAXExperience or exposure to any of the following is a plus: .NET, Apache Tomcat, Hibernate, Struts, Spring, Velocity, Crystal Reports, SQL Server Reporting Services, Linux, Liferay, Microsoft SharePointAbility to work as part of a small teamAbility to support existing systems and interact with end usersAbility to quickly learn and implement new technologiesStrong work ethic and ability to meet strict deadlinesStrong verbal and written communications skillsThe right candidate is a:Driven learner who loves researching new technologiesWell educated and experienced technologist who can function throughout the entire technical stackBusiness minded professional who understands how to transform business needs into technical solutionsCollaborative Engineer who is able to work independently or as part of a small teamStrong verbal and written communicator with the ability to interface directly with clientsHow to reach us:Email your resume to Abigail.Baker@echelonllc.comWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Overview CORNERSTONE RESEARCH Cornerstone Research is a consulting firm specializing in the analysis of complex financial, economic, accounting, and marketing issues. In recent years, Cornerstone Research has become one of the nation’s leading finance and economics consulting firms with more than 600 full-time staff members across eight offices.  We attribute our success to a unique combination of resources: a creative and energetic staff, cutting-edge research, and our network of academic and industry experts. Our consultants employ innovative problem solving approaches and achieve unparalleled analytic depth.  Cornerstone Research has consulted on a wide variety of projects involving numerous industries. Our clients include law firms, major corporations and financial firms, leading life sciences companies, major participants in energy markets, over one hundred Internet and other high-technology firms, and large telecommunications providers. These companies often have a large percentage of their net worth at stake when they seek our services. As such, our projects receive focused attention from chief executive officers, the general counsel and boards of directors of our clients.  CORNERSTONE RESEARCH’S CULTUREOur uniquely collegial and supportive atmosphere makes Cornerstone Research a great place to work. Cornerstone Research invests in its people in a number of ways including providing development opportunities and organizing memorable social events. To many, our culture and our people are the most exciting and enriching aspects of a career at Cornerstone Research. EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY Cornerstone Research is an equal employee opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or other factors protected by law. Responsibilities The Senior Manager, Recruiting Operations is responsible for recruitment operation capabilities for Cornerstone Research’s consulting staff firm-wide. This role will be responsible for managing a team and all systems related to the recruiting process. Responsibilities will include identifying areas for process improvement, and building upon existing tools, resources, technology and reporting/analytics to ensure alignment with the firm’s recruiting strategy and business needs. S/he will partner with the Director of Recruiting, senior leadership and staff at all levels to ensure that quality candidates are sourced, screened, and guided through the full recruitment process. Primary ResponsibilitiesTechnologyServe as the subject matter expert for recruiting technology support, including managing the applicant tracking system (built on iCIMS platform).Manage all system design and configuration changes.Help to design, identify and implement any additional technology solutions or upgrades to the current systems.Lead/support those involved in recruiting, ensuring they are fully trained and capable of leveraging the technology platform.ManagementManage and develop a remote team of 5 recruiting professionals.Build and evaluate the skills and capabilities of the team.Set clear performance expectations, providing on-the-job coaching and setting a specific learning plan for best practices.Evaluate performance regularly; deliver timely feedback and prepare and conduct thorough performance reviews.ProcessIdentify and implement best practices across the firm to streamline and standardize processes and ensure compliance with legal and client requirements.Identify, assess and recommend appropriate tools and resources to further enhance strategies and processes.Act as the day-to-day point person to coordinate all processes, ensuring timely execution and quality control.Responsible for budgeting and cost tracking throughout the year; work closely with the Director of Recruiting on cost control and understanding return on key investments.Develop, analyze and track recruitment metrics and reports to help drive top performance in all processes and strategies.Take the lead on overall management of summer programs across all offices.Create and Maintain high quality of engagement throughout the full recruitment life cycle; candidate through new employee orientation.Work closely with talent development team on delivery and content design of the orientation program.QualificationsBachelor’s degree required; relevant advanced degree (or coursework/external seminars) preferred.8+ years recruiting operations experience encompassing process development, system administration and analytics, preferably within professional services and/or academia.3+ years of direct staff management experience; preferably direct experience leading and managing teams with a strong preference for individuals with prior experience leading remote teams.Administrator or “super-user” experience with applicant tracking systems, experience in system configuration and reporting required; experience with iCIMS platform a plus.Leadership of a campus recruiting program a plus.Collaborative leadership style and demonstrated ability to partner with functional business leaders across all disciplines.Demonstrated strong analytical and quantitative skills and experience required.Proficiency in MS-office necessary; advanced capabilities in Excel (formulas, pivot tables) and PowerPoint a strong plus.Flexibility to travel required; travel may be frequent. This position will be located in our Boston, MA; Chicago, IL; or Washington, DC office.
